newsitem.title: USA: San Francisco panel okays wage, benefits increase.
newsitem.headline: San Francisco panel okays wage, benefits increase.

text.p: A San Francisco Board of Supervisors committee on Monday recommended approval of a wage and benefits package that was projected to cost more than $21 million over the next three years.
The Board's Government Efficiency and Labor Committee recommended that the full board approve the contract, which would give Municipal Railway drivers a 4.7 percent wage increase.
The full Board of Supervisors was expected to act on the union contract package later on Monday.
The wage increase was projected to cost San Francisco about $4.7 million for fiscal year 1996-1997, according to Harvey Rose, budget analyst to the Board of Supervisors.
The wage and benefits package will cost San Francisco at least $21.5 million over three years, Rose said.
